intro: Gleditsia triacanthos var. ferox, commonly known as the honeylocust, is a deciduous leguminous shrub or small tree native to the central and eastern United States. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into 10–20 pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces yellowish-green pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It has a deep root system that helps it thrive in dry, rocky soils. The plant is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, improving soil fertility.
